text: The A1 Serbia (serbian: A1 Srbija) is a Serbian telecommunication company owned by A1 Telekom Austria Group. As of 2020, it is the third largest mobile telephony operator with market share of 25.67%. ==History== On December 1, 2006, Telekom Austria bought the third mobile phone license in Serbia for GSM 900/1800 and UMTS networks by paying €320 million. Seeing the potential in Serbia's telecom market, Telekom Austria planned to invest up to €570 million in its first four years, including the €320 million spent on the license. This made the company to the largest Greenfield investment in Serbia at the time. In 2008, the company became the main sponsor of Serbia's national volleyball team. In 2015, A1's financial report showed €206.8 million in revenue. With 2.1 million customers, it had a 22.5% market share. ==Network Information== The IMSI - Network Code of A1 is 220-05 and MSISDN Network Codes are 060 (international: +381 60), 061 (international: +381 61) and 068 (international: +381 68). ==Network technology== *2G (GSM, GPRS, EDGE up to 250 kbit/s) on 900 MHz and 1800 MHz *3G (HSPA+ up to 42 Mbit/s) on 900 MHz and 2100 MHz *4G (LTE up to 225 Mbit/s) on 800 and 1800 MHz ==Related pages== * A1 Telekom Austria Group ==References== ==Other websites== * * Telecommunications Market of Serbia for 2016 at ratel.rs Category:Organizations based in Belgrade Category:Mobile phone companies Category:2006 establishments in Europe
title: A1 Serbia
